paragraphs.content: Awake, awake; put on thy strength, O Zion; put on thy beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city: for henceforth there shall no more come into thee the uncircumcised and the unclean.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Awake, awake; put on thy strength, O Zion; put on thy beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city: for henceforth there shall no more come into thee the uncircumcised and the unclean.

paragraphs.content: Shake thyself from the dust; arise, and sit down, O Jerusalem: loose thyself from the bands of thy neck, O captive daughter of Zion.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Shake thyself from the dust; arise, and sit down, O Jerusalem: loose thyself from the bands of thy neck, O captive daughter of Zion.

paragraphs.content: For thus saith the LORD, Ye have sold yourselves for nought; and ye shall be redeemed without money.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thus saith the Lord, Ye have sold yourselves for nought; and ye shall be redeemed without money.

paragraphs.content: For thus saith the Lord GOD, My people went down aforetime into Egypt to sojourn there; and the Assyrian oppressed them without cause.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thus saith the Lord God, My people went down aforetime into Egypt to sojourn there; and the Assyrian oppressed them without cause.

paragraphs.content: Now therefore, what have I here, saith the LORD, that my people is taken away for nought? they that rule over them make them to howl, saith the LORD; and my name continually every day is blasphemed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Now therefore, what have I here, saith the Lord, that my people is taken away for nought? they that rule over them make them to howl, saith the Lord; and my name continually every day is blasphemed.

paragraphs.content: Therefore my people shall know my name: therefore they shall know in that day that I am he that doth speak: behold, it is I.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore my people shall know my name: therefore they shall know in that day that I am he that doth speak: behold, it is I.

paragraphs.content: ¶ How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him that bringeth good tidings, that publisheth peace; that bringeth good tidings of good, that publisheth salvation; that saith unto Zion, Thy God reigneth!
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him that bringeth good tidings, that publisheth peace; that bringeth good tidings of good, that publisheth salvation; that saith unto Zion, Thy God reigneth!

paragraphs.content: Thy watchmen shall lift up the voice; with the voice together shall they sing: for they shall see eye to eye, when the LORD shall bring again Zion.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy watchmen shall lift up the voice; with the voice together shall they sing: for they shall see eye to eye, when the Lord shall bring again Zion.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Break forth into joy, sing together, ye waste places of Jerusalem: for the LORD hath comforted his people, he hath redeemed Jerusalem.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Break forth into joy, sing together, ye waste places of Jerusalem: for the Lord hath comforted his people, he hath redeemed Jerusalem.

paragraphs.content: The LORD hath made bare his holy arm in the eyes of all the nations; and all the ends of the earth shall see the salvation of our God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord hath made bare his holy arm in the eyes of all the nations; and all the ends of the earth shall see the salvation of our God.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Depart ye, depart ye, go ye out from thence, touch no unclean thing; go ye out of the midst of her; be ye clean, that bear the vessels of the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Depart ye, depart ye, go ye out from thence, touch no unclean thing; go ye out of the midst of her; be ye clean, that bear the vessels of the Lord.

paragraphs.content: For ye shall not go out with haste, nor go by flight: for the LORD will go before you; and the God of Israel will be your rearward.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For ye shall not go out with haste, nor go by flight: for the Lord will go before you; and the God of Israel will be your rearward.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Behold, my servant shall deal prudently, he shall be exalted and extolled, and be very high.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Behold, my servant shall deal prudently, he shall be exalted and extolled, and be very high.

paragraphs.content: As many were astonied at thee; his visage was so marred more than any man, and his form more than the sons of men:
paragraphs.contentHtml: As many were astonied at thee; his visage was so marred more than any man, and his form more than the sons of men:

paragraphs.content: So shall he sprinkle many nations; the kings shall shut their mouths at him: for that which had not been told them shall they see; and that which they had not heard shall they consider.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So shall he sprinkle many nations; the kings shall shut their mouths at him: for that which had not been told them shall they see; and that which they had not heard shall they consider.
